php.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language geared toward web development. It was originally created by Danish-Canadian programmer Rasmus Lerdorf in 1993 and released in 1995.

ruby.description: Ruby is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language which supports multiple programming paradigms. It was designed with an emphasis on programming productivity and simplicity.

javascript.description: JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS.

swift.description: Swift is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled programming language developed by Apple Inc.

java.description: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

dart.description: Dart is a programming language designed for client development, such as for the web and mobile apps.

python.description: Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.

scratch.description: Scratch is a high-level block-based visual programming language and website aimed primarily at children as an educational tool for programming.

R.description: R is a programming language for statistical computing and graphics supported by the R Core Team and the R Foundation for Statistical Computing.

c/c++.description: C++ is a powerful general-purpose programming language. It can be used to develop operating systems, browsers, games, and so on.
